detaileddescription.para: Type marker for timer_dev.

briefdescription.para: In this mode, the timer stops counting, channel interrupts are detached, and no state changes are output.

detaileddescription.para: This is the default mode for pins after initialization.

briefdescription.para: In this mode, the timer counts from 0 to its reload value repeatedly; every time the counter value reaches one of the channel compare values, the corresponding interrupt is fired.
Used to configure the behavior of a timer channel.

detaileddescription.para: Note that not all timers can be configured in every mode.

briefdescription.para: Update interrupt, available on all timers.
Capture/compare 1 interrupt, available on general and advanced timers only.
Capture/compare 2 interrupt, general and advanced timers only.
Capture/compare 3 interrupt, general and advanced timers only.
Capture/compare 4 interrupt, general and advanced timers only.
Trigger interrupt, general and advanced timers only.

detaileddescription.para: Not all timers support all of these values; see the descriptions for each value.

briefdescription.para: Base is slave mode control register.
Base is DMA interrupt enable register.
Base is break and dead-time register.
Base is DMA address for full transfer.

detaileddescription.para: Defines the base address for DMA transfers.

briefdescription.para: Frozen: comparison between output compare register and counter has no effect on the outputs.
OCxREF signal is forced high when the count matches the channel capture/compare register.
OCxREF signal is forced low when the counter matches the channel capture/compare register.
OCxREF toggles when counter matches the cannel capture/compare register.

detaileddescription.para: In upcounting, channel is active as long as count is less than channel capture/compare register, else inactive. In downcounting, channel is inactive as long as count exceeds capture/compare register, else active.

In upcounting, channel is inactive as long as count is less than capture/compare register, else active. In downcounting, channel is active as long as count exceeds capture/compare register, else inactive.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a timer, and reset its register map.

parameterdescription.para: Timer to initialize

detaileddescription.para: The timer will stop counting, all DMA requests and interrupts will be disabled, and no state changes will be output.

parameterdescription.para: Timer to disable.

briefdescription.para: Sets the mode of an individual timer channel.

detaileddescription.para: Note that not all timers can be configured in every mode. For example, basic timers cannot be configured to output compare mode. Be sure to use a timer which is appropriate for the mode you want.

parameterdescription.para: Timer whose channel mode to set
Relevant channel
New timer mode for channel

briefdescription.para: Call a function on timer devices.

parameterdescription.para: Function to call on each timer device.
Timer device
Interrupt number to attach to; this may be any timer_interrupt_id or timer_channel value appropriate for the timer.
Handler to attach to the given interrupt.
Timer device
Interrupt number to detach; this may be any timer_interrupt_id or timer_channel value appropriate for the timer.

briefdescription.para: Initialize all timer devices on the chip.
Disables all timers on the device.
Stop a timer's counter from changing.

detaileddescription.para: Does not affect the timer's mode or other settings.

parameterdescription.para: Device whose counter to pause.

detaileddescription.para: Does not affect the timer's mode or other settings.

parameterdescription.para: Device whose counter to resume

detaileddescription.para: This value is likely to be inaccurate if the counter is running with a low prescaler.

parameterdescription.para: Timer whose counter to return

briefdescription.para: Sets the counter value for the given timer.

parameterdescription.para: Timer whose counter to set
New counter value

detaileddescription.para: Note that if the timer's prescaler is set (e.g. via timer_set_prescaler() or accessing a TIMx_PSC register), the value returned by this function will reflect the new setting, but the timer's counter will only reflect the new prescaler at the next update event.

parameterdescription.para: Timer whose prescaler to return

detaileddescription.para: The new value will not take effect until the next update event.

parameterdescription.para: Timer whose prescaler to set
New prescaler value
Timer whose reload value to return
Timer whose reload value to set
New reload value to use. Takes effect at next update event.

briefdescription.para: Get the compare value for the given timer channel.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
Channel whose compare value to get.

briefdescription.para: Set the compare value for the given timer channel.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
Channel whose compare value to set.
New compare value.

briefdescription.para: Generate an update event for the given timer.

detaileddescription.para: Normally, this will cause the prescaler and auto-reload values in the PSC and ARR registers to take immediate effect. However, this function will do nothing if the UDIS bit is set in the timer's CR1 register (UDIS is cleared by default).

parameterdescription.para: Timer device to generate an update for.

briefdescription.para: Enable a timer's trigger DMA request.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL

briefdescription.para: Disable a timer's trigger DMA request.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL

briefdescription.para: Enable a timer channel's DMA request.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL
Channel whose DMA request to enable.

briefdescription.para: Disable a timer channel's DMA request.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
Channel whose DMA request to disable.
Timer device.
Interrupt number to enable; this may be any timer_interrupt_id value appropriate for the timer.
Timer device.
Interrupt number to disable; this may be any timer_interrupt_id value appropriate for the timer.

briefdescription.para: Enable a timer channel's capture/compare signal.

detaileddescription.para: If the channel is configured as output, the corresponding output compare signal will be output on the corresponding output pin. If the channel is configured as input, enables capture of the counter value into the input capture/compare register.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
Channel to enable, from 1 to 4.

briefdescription.para: Disable a timer channel's output compare or input capture signal.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
Channel to disable, from 1 to 4.

briefdescription.para: Get a channel's capture/compare output polarity.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
Channel whose capture/compare output polarity to get.

briefdescription.para: Set a timer channel's capture/compare output polarity.

detaileddescription.para: If the timer channel is configured as output: polarity == 0 means the output channel will be active high; polarity == 1 means active low.

If the timer channel is configured as input: polarity == 0 means capture is done on the rising edge of ICn; when used as an external trigger, ICn is non-inverted. polarity == 1 means capture is done on the falling edge of ICn; when used as an external trigger, ICn is inverted.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
Channel whose capture/compare output polarity to set.
New polarity, 0 or 1.

briefdescription.para: Get a timer's DMA burst length.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.

simplesect.para: Number of bytes to be transferred per DMA request, from 1 to 18.

briefdescription.para: Set a timer's DMA burst length.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
DMA burst length; i.e., number of bytes to transfer per DMA request, from 1 to 18.

briefdescription.para: Get the timer's DMA base address.

detaileddescription.para: Some restrictions apply; see ST RM0008.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.

briefdescription.para: Set the timer's DMA base address.

detaileddescription.para: Some restrictions apply; see ST RM0008.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
DMA base address.

memberdef.argsstring: (timer_dev *dev, uint8 channel, timer_oc_mode mode, uint8 flags)
memberdef.name: timer_oc_set_mode

briefdescription.para: Configure a channel's output compare mode.

parameterdescription.para: Timer device, must have type TIMER_ADVANCED or TIMER_GENERAL.
Channel to configure in output compare mode.
Timer mode to set.
OR of timer_oc_mode_flags.

simplesect.para: Marti Bolivar <mbolivar@leaflabs.com> Replaces old timers.h implementation.
